txt.en: 'No! I forbid you to leave the Thane unprotected.'
'It is your duty to stand between Radwig and any who dare threaten him.'
'I... yes, my lady. Of course.'
'This is not open for debate. The townsfolk need protection.'
Floodwend
'But Thane, your mother is right --'
'Here they come!'
'Forgive me if I did not make myself clear....'
'Let me try this again.'
'You shall not go out, Radwig. It is too dangerous!'
'If you do not do the duty your Thane assigned you at once, and protect your people...'
'I will go, and there will be no more discussion on the matter. Let us meet on the field.'
'...I will throw you in the stocks when this battle is done.'
Guard
'Our apologies, Thane Radwig!'
Guard
'Guards!'
'Yes, my Thane?'
'You must leave this Hall at once and go defend the town.'
'Heh... reminds me of his father, does that one.'
'Radwig....'
'I am not a boy any longer, mother. I am responsible for my father's people.'
'I know, my dear son. You were right, of course.'
'You do not know how hard it is to watch you become a true Thane.'
'But I am so proud of you. You are so much like your father.'
'Thank you, mother. And do not worry! [placeholder] fights bravely. We are in good hands.'
'It is over....'
'What of our people? Are we all that is left?'
